snippet: President Obama defied deep Republican opposition to appoint Richard Cordray as director of a new consumer protection agency and fill three labor board vacancies.
abstract: President Obama defies Republican opposition to appoint Richard Cordray as director of the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau and fill three labor board vacancies; he paints GOP opposition to Cordray as another sign of the party putting the interests of Wall Street above the concerns of ordinary Americans; Republicans accuse Obama of abusing recess privilege.

byline.original: By HELENE COOPER and JENNIFER STEINHAUER
byline.contributor: Charlie Savage contributed reporting from Washington, and Steven Greenhouse from New York.

lead_paragraph: President Obama defied deep Republican opposition to appoint Richard Cordray as director of a new consumer protection agency and fill three labor board vacancies.

headline.seo: Richard Cordray Named Consumer Chief in Recess Appointment
headline.main: Bucking Senate, Obama Appoints Consumer Chief
headline.print_headline: Bucking Senate, Obama Appoints Consumer Chief
